pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ ciInf_lt_iff`
`+ csInf_lt_iff`
`+ lt_ciSup_iff`
`+ lt_ciSup_iff'`
`+ lt_csSup_iff`
`+ lt_csSup_iff'`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
Looks like CI passes on this â€“ are you happy to go ahead? If so, please remove the "awaiting author" tag and I'll flag it for maintainer-merging.
Yep, I like these new golfs.
maintainer merge
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by loefflerd.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11459416860/job/31883853439)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11459416860/job/31883853202)

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
Thanks for this nice contribution! I found a few small golfs using `Iff.not`.

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

```suggestion
  simpa only [not_le, not_forallâ‚‚, exists_prop] using (csSup_le_iff hb hs (a := a)).not
```

```suggestion
  simpa only [not_le, not_forallâ‚‚, exists_prop] using (le_csInf_iff hb hs).not
```

```suggestion
  simpa only [mem_range, exists_exists_eq_and] using lt_csSup_iff hb (range_nonempty _)
```

```suggestion
  simpa only [mem_range, exists_exists_eq_and] using csInf_lt_iff hb (range_nonempty _)
```

```suggestion
  simpa only [not_le, not_forallâ‚‚, exists_prop] using (csSup_le_iff' hb).not
```

```suggestion
    simpa only [not_le, not_forall] using (ciSup_le_iff' h).not
```

```suggestion
set_option linter.style.longFile 1800
```
(the file is < 1700 lines with above changes, and the linter complains the limit is set too high.)
I made a new PR #18029, based on top of this one, which splits the file into two smaller pieces by moving all the lemmas about indexed sup / inf to a separate file.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Order/ConditionallyCompleteLattice): `lt_ciSup_iff` and variants
